TopicTitle: Interesting destinations for future manned missions to the Moon

Articles.Content: What would be some interesting areas for future lunar astronauts/cosmonauts/taikonauts to visit?

Personally I would like to see the North or South pole looked at next.

The south pole may even have more ice than the north, specifically Shackleton crater.

Poles, obviously.

SMART-1 crash side or in general - most recent craters.

Why, North-east Tycho of course!

2001 theme plays...

In all seriousness, the poles are a good place to start. Although, I think some of the planned Apollo sites that never got visited should also be on the list.

Why, North-east Tycho of course!

Where's 13's site?

Kinda right there. Incidentally, this crater was formed on the day I was born.
